gurmukhi: cvI cwvfIAM iklMkwr kMkM ]guQI lu`Q ju`QM bhy bIr bMkM ]3]
transliteration: Chavoo Chaavadooan Kilankaar Kankan|| Gouthoo Loutth Joutthan Bade Boor Bankan||3||
translation: Somewhere the terrible goddess Chamunda is shouting and somewhere the vultures are shrieking. Somewhere the corpses of youthful warriors are lying inter-lovked.3.

gurmukhi: prI ku`t kutM ruly q`C mu`CM ]rhy hwQ fwry auBY aurD mu`CM ]
transliteration: Daroo Koutt Kouttan Rule Tachchh Mouchchhan|| Rahe Haath Ddare Oubhai Urdh Mouchchannd||
translation: There had been tough battle, because of which the chopped corpses are rolling in dush. Somewhere the dead warriors are lying uncared with their hands on their whiskers.

gurmukhi: khUM KoprI Kol iKMgM KqMgM ]khUM KqRIXM K`g KyqM inKMgM ]4]
transliteration: Kahoon Khoproo Dhol Khingadg Khatanadg|| Kahoon Khatrooan Khagg Khetan Nikhanndan||4||
translation: Somewhere the skulls, helmets, bows and arrows are lying scattered. Somewhere the swords and quivers of the warriors are there in the battlefield.4.

gurmukhi: cvI cwNvfI fwknI fwk mwry ]khUM BYrvI BUq BYroN bkwry ]
transliteration: Chavoo Chaanvadoo Daakanoo Daak Mdare|| Kahoon Bhairavoo Bhoot Bhairon Bakdare||
translation: Somewhere the vultures shriek and somewhere the vampire is belching.

gurmukhi: khUM bIr bYqwl bMky ibhwrM ]khUM BUq pRyqM hsy mwshwrM ]5]
transliteration: Kahoon Boor Baitaal Banke Bihaaran|| Kahoon Bhoot Pretan Hase Maasahaaran||5||
translation: Somewhere the evil spirits and ghosts are walking slantingly, somewhere the ghosts, fiends and meateaters are laughing.5.

transliteration: Mahaan Boor Gadje|| Sounai Megh Lajje||
translation: Hearing the thunder of minghty warriors, the clouds felt shy.

transliteration: Jhandaa Gadd Gaddhe|| Mande Ros Baadhe||6||
translation: Strong banners have been fixed and highly infuriated the heroes are enaged in war.6.
Holding their swords and daggers, they are fighting in great anger.

transliteration: Mahaan Boor Bankan|| Bhire Bhoom Hankan||7||
translation: The winsome great heroes, with their fighting, make the earth tremble.7.

transliteration: Mach3 Soor Sastran|| Outhoo Jhaar Astran||
translation: The warriors are fighting with their weapons in great excitement, the weapons as well as the armour are glistening.
There is the great steel-killing with weapons like swords and daggers.8.

gurmukhi: h`nbI jun`bI srohI duDwrI ]bhI kop kwqI kiRpwxM ktwrI ]
transliteration: Hallaboo Jounabboodarohoo Dudhdaroo|| Badoo Kop Kaatoo Kridaanan Katdaroo||
translation: Various types of swords, the swords from Halab and Junab, Sarohi swords and the double-deged sword, knife, spear and dagger were struck with great ire.
